per_sample.question: What is the greatest commandment according to Jesus?
per_sample.answer: Jesus teaches that the greatest commandment is to love God with all your heart and to love your neighbour as yourself.
contexts: [1] You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. This is the great and first commandment.
[2] And a second is like it: You shall love your neighbour as yourself.
ground_truth: Jesus summarises the law as loving God fully and loving one's neighbour (Matthew 22:37-39).

citations.snippet: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.
And a second is like it: You shall love your neighbour as yourself.

per_sample.question: Summarise Paul's teaching on grace in Ephesians 2
per_sample.answer: Paul emphasises that salvation is a gift by grace through faith, not earned by works.
contexts: [1] For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God.
[2] Not a result of works, so that no one may boast.
ground_truth: Ephesians 2:8-9 states salvation is by grace through faith and not by works.

citations.snippet: For by grace you have been saved through faith.
Not a result of works, so that no one may boast.

dataset_row.ground_truth: Ephesians 2:8-9 states salvation is by grace through faith and not by works.

per_sample.question: How does Psalm 23 describe God's guidance?
per_sample.answer: Psalm 23 portrays God as a shepherd who leads, protects, and comforts through every valley.
contexts: [1] The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
[2] He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake.
[3] Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
ground_truth: Psalm 23:1-4 depicts the Lord guiding, providing, and comforting as a shepherd.

citations.snippet: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul.
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
